instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage ssd problem.
threads.message:
get error 6 on DFU.
i sew water damage under <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> clean and reball.
all the ssd voltage are pulsing from the correct voltage to 0v.
diode mode on <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL>-<SIGNAL>PP2V5_SW2_TPS62180_SSD0</SIGNAL> - 060
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0</SIGNAL> - 430

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage ssd problem.
threads.message:
Damaged NAND chip, very likely.

Just for reference, these are diode mode readings I got:
L9020/21    410
L9030        385
L9080/81    401
The other channel (L95xx) should have similar values.

Don't expect to get exact same readings on your board, but in same range.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage ssd problem.
threads.message:
all o.k except  L9080/81 060
still NAND? anything to do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage ssd problem.
threads.message:
Lift the coils and check where the low value remains.
Did you replace <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage ssd problem.
threads.message:
its  <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL>.
i didn't replace <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> but also without him  <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL>  is 060

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage ssd problem.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage ssd problem.
threads.message:
060 is very low.
You should get similar readings like the other SSD channel.

Corrosion under <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> caused leakage from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> power rail.
Difficult to find the culprit, as you don't have a pure short there.
Just in case, remove the filter caps.
